name: DoubleTree by Hilton Hotel Aqaba

reviews.text: A friend and myself stayed in the Doubletree for 8 days in Oct 2011. While the staff were friendly and the room was a good 4* (4* amenities and decor), we encountered a variety of problems with our stay.
reviews.title: Not recommended for a long stay

reviews.text: The general problem seems to be that the staff, although polite and friendly, have insufficient training. Firstly on ordering the famous doubletree cookies everybody mentions in their reviews, the hotel told us they would be unable to provide us with them until the day after (although they have a card in the room saying cookies can be made within 30 minutes). A few cosmetic problems with the room started to prove a problem: the window wouldn't completely shut so we could hear the traffic at night, the sealant started to come off the bath so damp started forming under the floor causing a smell, additionally some of the lighting was broken (but was not repaired after informing them). On ordering cocktails at the swimming pool, there was a 30 minute delay whilst the lady phoned a colleague for the recipe - the drink came and my pale pink 7 JD (7 USD, 6 Euro) Singapore Sling tasted like water. If there is a cocktail menu, staff should be trained in making cocktails! The dinner buffet was almost in the pitch dark and at 26 JD was poor value and a poor selection compared to the equivalently priced Movenpick buffet in Aqaba round the corner. Additionally each time "careline", was called, we noticed none of the problems ending up being fixed or resolved. At one point we requested their in-house doctor (available according to the booklet in the room). The first time we phoned careline they didn't understand what we wanted and told us they would send an "engineer" up. On speaking to the customer service manager, we found the doctor was not in fact on site at all and could only be brought on site for 75 US dollars. Doubletree ought to ensure the information provided to the customer is correct. A final complaint was the diabolically slow internet speeds (that were charged as a daily extra): so slow even google took several seconds to load.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel
Very friendly hotel, spotless and with great food
reviews.text: The customer service manager did phone during the stay to check "everything was 100%" and on telling her the cookie problem offered to send some up to the room. However it appears even she was beset by the lack of cookies, since these never arrived either. Its dissappointing when even the manager is unable to rectify problems.

Overall, this hotel was generally pleasant to stay at but the continual problems with customer service (which might not be evident to those that only stay 1 or 2 nights) mean I would not recommend for a long stay. A quick comparison after the holiday showed that for a similar price, purchasing breakfast each morning, the price of the 5* Aqaba Movenpick was equivalent price (which based on their 5* buffet and their attention to detail would probably have been a significantly better stay).
reviews.title: Brilliant !!!

reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here for 3 nights in September. Our first impressions of the property were fantastic. My husband is a HiltonHonors Diamond member and the management really rolled out the red carpets for us. We were greeted by all of the managers of the hotel, upgraded to a lovely room, and sent fruit, cookies and tea as a welcome. The room was very large and well appointed. There were various construction issues (shower door didn't close all the way, robe hook was loose, mini bar fridge was not cold) but nothing major that disrupted our stay. The bed was extremely comfortable and provided a great night's rest. The staff at the breakfast buffet is extremely attentive, but almost to the point of being bothersome. They were constantly asking if we needed anything else, but after 3 or 4 times, it got a little old. I understand that they are trying to receive top marks in customer service but they need additional training on not crossing the line between attentiveness and being nuisances. The buffet itself was delicious and there was plenty on offer. I think it was overpriced, however. I agree with others' comments that the hotel staff seems a little disorganized. At the lounge, we ordered a beer but they were out, same thing happened at the pool. When we phoned the Careline about snorkeling and laundry, they seemed a bit confused. When we checked out the first time (since we were leaving for Petra) they charged us for our breakfast buffets even though we were told they were complimentary. My husband travels nearly every day for work and stays almost exclusively with Hilton properties and had to educate the staff that Diamond members are entitled to a free breakfast, while the staff was saying we are entitled to either a free breakfast or an upgrade, but not both. As I mentioned, we departed for Petra then returned back to the Doubletree. We stored our luggage with the hotel and had no problems with it whatsoever. When we checked back in after our visit to Petra, the manager informed us that he had misunderstood the policy and that the Diamond member gets both the upgrade and the breakfast and apologized for the prior confusion. We ate at the restaurant for dinner and found it to be delicious, although it was a little expensive relative to what you would pay around town. We really enjoyed the fact that the chef was experimenting with various appetizers and brought a tray around for us to sample and comment on. It was kind of fun. While staying the second time around, we helped ourselves to the peanuts and wine split and were charged upon checkout. We also had them the first stay but weren't charged at check out. We honestly thought they were free and not part of the mini bar since they weren't in the mini bar and didn't have a price list next to them, so that was confusing. We swam at the pool, which was nice but nothing special. We also went to the resort's beach and pool complex which was still under construction while we were there. It will be very beautiful when finished but it wasn't ideal when we were there since the water in the pools was absolutely freezing and unbearable and all of the workers were staring at me since I was in a bikini. I felt uncomfortable and didn't enjoy the experience. Overall, I would stay at the Doubletree again, I would just be sure not to eat the peanuts or wine and wouldn't eat at the restaurant again (not because there's anything wrong with the food, just because it's cheaper outside of the hotel.) I think the property has a lot of potential but will only fully realize it once the bugs associated with it being a recently opened hotel are worked out. Also worth noting is the fact that the Doubletree cookies in Jordan are VASTLY superior to the ones in California, they were truly the most delicous cookies I've ever eaten in my life!!
reviews.title: Lovely hotel, staff still needs training

reviews.text: I stayed with Double Tree by Hilton in Zanzibar (Tanzania) and had fantastic experience with them and that is the reason we decided to chose Double Tree for our trip to Aqaba.

reviews.text: Though property is good but services are poor......i.e. electric bulb in one of the night lamps was missing and was not replaced despite telling housekeeping twice....
reviews.title: An Excellent

reviews.text: they claim to deliver cookies on 20 minutes notice but i ordered 5 cans of cookies 2 days in advance and while checking out, they were not ready.....found a debit of 4-5 JD in my bill as a surprise...later found out it was for cookies..............cookies????? how come?? i ordered 5 cans of cookies and price of 5 cans of cookies can not be 5 JD....sir give us 5 minutes we are checking.....sorry sir, instead of 5 cans we packed 5 cookies for you........wow...anyway can i get 5 cans of cookies now.....sure sir give us 10 minutes......after waiting for 15 minutes....we were finally delivered 5 bags with cookies.....i thought it was over....but not..those bag were full of surprises...yes...cookies loosely packed without cans....why no cans???? sorry sir, we have run out of cans....oh ya...did u check with me before packing...sorry sir.........by this time i had already spent more than 30 minutes at reception waiting to clear my bill and check out.....any way i decided to return 3 out of 5 bags and they were meant to be for gifts...sir please give us another 10 minutes to correct ur bill....ok..do i have a choice...waiting for 15 minutes and still no answer....i lost my cool and talked to manager...who decided to give is 2 bags of cookies complementry as a favor for making us waiting at reception for 45 minutes....wow...........please never order cookies at Double Tree...............................Pradeep & family
reviews.title: So happy we came back.

reviews.text: Me, my wife and my brothers stayed there for one night on October 21 and left the hotel on October 22. We took the rooms 204, 205 and 207 (All with a City View). They have also Pool View and Partially Sea View Rooms.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.text: We Stayed at this lovely hotel for 5 nights with our kids & were very happy with our choice.The Deluxe sea view room for us & the Large Junior suite for our kids we had were both luxurious & comfortable with comfy beds.The hotel provides FREE internet which is really handy.The Reception Staff especially Lara were helpful & friendly at all times.The cookies given to us all at check in was delicious.The restaurants served delicious food at reasonable prices.Location in city center is excellent & with the complimentary option which we took advantage of to visit their beach club near tala bay where we did snorkeling Breakfast was adequate with fresh orange juice & anything you would want.A big thank you to Hilton Double tree Aqaba for making our first trip to Jordan a great one & we will definitely stay again!
reviews.title: Great Hotel,Central,New ,good facilities & Service

reviews.text: This is a new property in the heart of Aqaba and it was perfectly located near the action of the city's life. Large, clean rooms. Very accomodating staff. The manager, Dena, was very helpful with our needs and made sure our stay was special.

description: The Doubletree by Hilton Aqaba hotel overlooks the Red Sea’s Gulf of Aqaba on the southern coastal tip of Jordan. Our upscale, full service hotel in Aqaba City Center is conveniently situated in the heart of the business district, a short walk to the sea shore and all major shopping areas. King Hussein International Airport (AQJ) is less than 15 minutes from the DoubleTree, making our hotel the perfect location for those visiting Aqaba on business or leisure. An Aqaba hotel with DoubleTree by Hilton comfort. Our modern hotel, influenced by contemporary Italian design, boasts spacious guest rooms and suites with a long list of upscale guest room amenities. Enjoy Red Sea views, 32-inch LCD TVs, generous work surfaces, luxurious baths, our ultra comfortable Sweet Dreams® by DoubleTree Sleep Experience beds and high-speed internet access. For your convenience, wireless HSIA is available in public areas throughout the hotel. Our guests also have full access to first rate hotel amenities and services: Semi-covered, infinity-style swimming pool overlooking the Gulf of Aqaba, Two whirlpools, Sauna and steam room. A well-equipped Fitness Center by Life Fitness® Concierge services 24-hour in room dining. Superb dining at our Aqaba hotel near the sea shore. You'll enjoy a variety of dining and refreshment options at the DoubleTree Aqaba, including tasty lunch menu favorites and a tempting dinner buffet. And don't forget to start the day right with our extensive DoubleTree Breakfast buffet. Beef lovers will feel at home in our King’s restaurant, featuring an excellent selection of top-quality meat and international premium wines. For a hip music and dining experience, join us at D-Lounge for trendy decor and fusion cuisine. Or, for a quick bite or casual meeting, stop by our Tree Cafe serving freshly brewed coffees and teas, homemade pastry and a wide selection of snacks. Prefer to combine lounging and lunch? Infinity, renowned for its scenic views over the Gulf of Aqaba, is your kind of place. Sip exotic cocktails and mocktails and energize with a healthy lunch and snacks by the pool.Our modern hotel in Aqaba is tops for business. Planning an important conference or meeting in Aqaba? Our meeting and banquet facilities are at your disposal. Our team of meeting and catering professionals will ensure an impressive and successful event. Valet parking, elegant pre-function space, break-out room and conference support services such as state-of-the-art audio/visual solutions with integrated synchronic translation cabin, a Business Center, printing and secretarial services and inspired food and beverage services are available for your next Middle East business meeting, conference, seminar, dinner, reception, or gala social occasion. See Aqaba from the DoubleTree. From the DoubleTree by Hilton Aqaba hotel, take in Jordanian cultural sights or simply enjoy the crystal waters of the Red Sea. Visit local and regional Aqaba attractions such as Aqaba Fort, built by the Crusaders. Lounge on sandy beaches or partake in water sports including water skiing, fishing, snorkeling and world class scuba diving. Divers of all levels will appreciate dive tours from Aqaba on the Red Sea coast and the beautiful Yamanieh coral reef, home to stunning marine life. Experience extraordinary dessert scenery in the Wadi Rum river valley, visit the ancient ruins of Petra or haggle at the Jerusalem Bazaar. Whether you come to Aqaba for business or a seaside vacation, our courteous and helpful hotel staff looks forward to welcoming you to Jordan with our signature, warm DoubleTree Chocolate Chip Cookie at check-in.
